Hi there

We use the command 'equilibrate' in Matlab to calculate the balanced 
state of an ideal gas mixture. Now we would like to keep the 
concentration of one of the substances (Methane) constant. In other
words: It should not take part in the overall reaction.

What is the easiest way to do this? Should we only take a part of the 
gas into our considerations or exists there a way to tell CANTERA 
which reactions are not desired?

We would be grateful for any piece of advice.

          Thomas Brunner and Markus Wuethrich, ETH Zurich
